live_updates.title: 'Spurs are in for a tough test tomorrow'
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News' Sanny Rudravajhala:
"Rodri was on crutches when he arrived to collect the Ballon d’Or back in October. After being out for 236 days with an anterior cruciate ligament tear, another injury, picked up at the Club World Cup has hampered his return.
"But the big news today is that he is back!
"As Pep Guardiola pointed out, in a few months, the world will appoint a new Ballon d’Or winner, but for now Rodri holds that accolade and when I asked the manager how much of a boost his return is, he replied that he is "still the best in the world".
"Rodri’s return, coupled with the City boss revealing that Phil Foden is also fit again, are huge boosts ahead of Spurs on Saturday. Rodri "needs minutes", so I’d expect a rousing Etihad reception, perhaps off the bench, for the Spaniard tomorrow.
"Guardiola wouldn’t be drawn when I asked him on outgoings - the futures of Manuel Akanji and Savinho remain unknown. As does that of goalkeeper, Ederson.
"Guardiola says the goalkeeper is fit again after illness but told me that he will decide at dinner tonight on whether James Trafford will stay in the sticks or whether the Brazilian will return.
"Trafford was impressive on his debut for City and his incredible performances for Burnley last season have pushed him into the England frame. Guardiola has a huge call to make, which could have impacts felt as far as next year’s World Cup.
"As is typical of the City boss, he was full of praise for a ‘top manager’ in Thomas Frank and was similarly positive about his new assistant, Pep Lijnders.
"Jurgen Klopp’s former right-hand man is now Guardiola’s assistant and came into the City backroom as part of a summer refresh together with Liverpool’s James French on set pieces and former City and Arsenal defender, Kolo Toure.
"Guardiola, in a pastel yellow hoody looked relaxed and appears refreshed after a difficult season that was put behind them with positive showings at the Club World Cup.
"My impression is that the staff, players and the manager have all returned from the USA in a positive place and combined with their 4-0 win at Wolves, it’s fair to say Spurs are in for a tough test tomorrow."

live_updates.title: Pereira speaks on Strand Larsen exit talk
live_updates.author: Adam Bate
live_updates.text:
Vitor Pereira
has made it clear how important
Jorgen Strand Larsen
is to
Wolves
but stopped short of guaranteeing that the Norwegian striker would remain at the club this summer amid reports of interest from
Newcastle
.
“He's a very important player for us. I never talk with him about it. He's our player. When I watch him on the training, he's committed with everybody, committed with the team. He's a fighter. He likes to win. He's preparing himself to play tomorrow.”
Asked if Wolves could afford to lose a key player between now and the end of the transfer window, Pereira added: “I don't know. The market is the market. If the window is open, the players can come and the players can leave. I believe this is possible.”

live_updates.title: Pereira positive Wolves will strengthen
live_updates.author: Adam Bate
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Adam Bate at Wolves' training ground:
With
Jackson Tchatchoua
having arrived from Hellas Verona,
Wolves
are targeting at least two more signings before the close of the transfer window and
Vitor Pereira
says that he is confident that the squad will be strong enough to compete once the dust settles.
“The club is working to help us because they know what we need since the beginning. They are working and I believe that we can bring the positions that we need to have competition inside the group.
“I believe that we will have a good team. We are in a process to build our way to play because we have different players this season.
“Some of them, we lost some of them from the first 11. This is time to rebuild the things, the behaviours, to understand, to connect everybody. Of course, we know what we are doing.
“We know what is in our minds for the future. They are working very well in the way that I like. Because of that, I'm positive.”

live_updates.title: Fulham to assess Robinson and Sessegnon
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Fulham
will assess
Antonee Robinson
and
Ryan Sessegnon
in their final training session on Saturday before facing
Manchester United.
Robinson had surgery on a knee injury at the start of the summer, while Sessegnon picked up an issue in the final game of pre-season.

live_updates.title: 'Fulham miss out on main targets as poor summer continues'
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports David Richardson at Fulham's training ground:
"It's been another bittersweet week for Fulham. Rodrigo Muniz is 'likely to stay' according to boss Marco Silva, but he also admitted the club's transfer plans have 'failed'.
"With only 10 days left until the transfer window closes on September 1, Silva is desperate for more incomings.
"Those potential signings, though, are no longer their 'main targets', according to Silva, and the club now has to move in a different direction.
"They face a Man Utd side on Sunday, live on
Sky Sports
, that has spent over £200m this summer. How Silva would love to do that..."

live_updates.title: Nuno: 'No smoke without fire' over sack fears
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text:
Nottingham Forest boss Nuno Espirito Santo has cast doubt over his future after admitting “where there’s smoke, there’s fire” amid rumours about his job.
Speculation is rife that the Portuguese’s position is under threat after his relationship with owner Evangelos Marinakis has deteriorated.
Nuno, who was handed a new contract in June after guiding Forest into Europe last term, was seemingly accepting that his time at the club could be over after saying his connection with Marinakis has changed.
“We know each other very well, and we have all been in the industry for a while now,” he said ahead of Sunday’s Premier League game at Crystal Palace.
“And where there’s smoke, there’s fire, so I know how things work, but I’m here to do my job.
“I understand, because I’m worried. I’m the first one to be worried. I’m the first one to be concerned.”

live_updates.title: Muniz 'likely' to stay at Fulham but club's transfer plan has 'failed'
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Marco Silva
believes striker
Rodrigo Muniz
is "likely to stay" at
Fulham
and hopes they can renew his contract, but says the club’s summer transfer plans have "failed".
Muniz had been heavily linked with a move to Atalanta, but
Sky Sports News
reported this week that Fulham hadrejected all bids and approaches.
The striker scored a late equaliser for Fulham last weekend at Brighton and Silva confirmed he is expected to stay.
"We don't want to lose him, right now he's completely in contention for the game (on Sunday)," said Silva. "I'm counting on him, let's see what is going to happen.
"I cannot guarantee 100 per cent but yes, Rodrigo is likely to stay with us and let's hope we can renew his contract."
However, Fulham have only made one signing this summer and Silva is desperate for more incomings.
"We had a plan and the plan until now didn't go through, it's as simple as that," added Silva. "We have to look at ourselves, it's our fault, it's not the fault of the market.
"I cannot tell you that someone is going to arrive tomorrow or in two day's time because I'm not sure and, to be honest, I have big doubts that it's going to happen.
Silva added: “That plan failed until      now, it is clear.
"We need solutions in the back line, we are short in certain positions there, we need another midfielder to come in as well.
"Some of our targets or the main targets are no more, we have to go in a different direction right now."

live_updates.title: 'Emery repeats frustrations over squad depth'
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News' Rob Jones at Unai Emery's press conference:
"It is very difficult to argue that Aston Villa are in a better place now than when they finished last season squad-wise, and Unai Emery, in an underestimated manner, once again repeated his frustrations that the purse strings can’t be a little looser at the moment
"Emery spoke of hoping to have had more deals done earlier in the window on the week where Leon Bailey and Leander Dendoncker have both left the club with Alex Moreno set to follow.
"The latter two may be surplus to requirements but Emery wants two players for every position, and in attack, Villa are light and stretched at centre back too, particularly with Ezri Konsa suspended against his former club Brentford tomorrow."

live_updates.title: Harsh decision to award penalty against Dewsbury-Hall?
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
INCIDENT:
Brighton win a penalty at Everton. The Premier League Match Centre says Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall made himself unjustifiably bigger. He’s so close to the shot, isn't this harsh?
DERMOT SAYS:
"It is harsh, but it is the rule.
"If you look at it, his arm is out. It hits his arm. It's a shot on goal, so it's always going to be punished.
"Once your arm is up that high, it's always going to be given."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS
: "I don't think that is an unnatural position, to be honest. His hand is close to his body. If his hand is out and it hits his hand then I would say definitely.
"It shouldn't be a penalty in my eyes because all he's done is try to block a shot. You don't think about where your hands are, but his hand is still close to his chest."

live_updates.title: Will keepers now start going down after Martinez earns foul at Villa?
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
INCIDENT:
Brentford's Mikkel Damsgaard scored to make it 2-0 against Aston Villa, but it was ruled out.
A post on the Premier League Match Centre on X said: "The referee’s call of no goal following a foul by Nathan Collins on Emi Martinez was checked and confirmed by VAR - with it deemed that Collins carelessly challenged the goalkeeper."
DERMOT SAYS:
"Not many people expected a foul there. It's not what I'd call a clear foul.
"The referee gives a foul, that's his choice. The problem is, when the VAR looks at it, you see him go into Martinez."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
"The whole time, Collins is looking at the ball. There's been contact. Last week, Bayindir stayed on his feet [against Arsenal] and he got punished for that one. When you look at Martinez, same thing but he's just gone down.
"If Martinez had stayed on his feet, he wouldn't have got it."

live_updates.title: Should Arsenal's penalty have been awarded?
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
INCIDENT:
Arsenal wonderkid Max Dowman wins a penalty after going down under minimal contact from Leeds' Anton Stach in the box.
DERMOT SAYS:
"This is where we have a problem, isn't it?
"In isolation, we can discuss this, but when you piece it together, one after the other like this, there's no doubt there is much more contact in the Man City game than there is here.
"He does make contact; he just steps on his foot."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS
: "When you're moving at speed, the smallest clip or touch can stifle you and you will go down.
"But the Oscar Bobb one, there's much more contact on that one - and the defender in this one hasn't really lunged, he's just put his foot in the wrong position, which has caught Dowman."

live_updates.title: Should Timber's second have been ruled out?
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
INCIDENT:
The ball hit William Saliba's arm in the build-up to Jurrien Timber's second goal. We're told if the ball touches the attacker's hand in creating a goal it won't count. So explain this one...
DERMOT SAYS:
"I'm not convinced it hits his hand, but if it does, it's accidental. And because he's not the scorer, he can't be penalised.
"If it does strike his arm or his hand and he scores, it's disallowed."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
"Because both players are so close together, even if it does hit his hand, I think it's harsh to not give that goal.
"Both players are going for it and it's there - it's going to hit someone's arm because it's so high.
"If he moves his hand onto the ball, that's different."

live_updates.title: 'If that was the deciding decision, there'd be uproar!' Split on Trafford call
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
INCIDENT:
The ball hits Man City keeper James Trafford's arm outside the box, why isn't it given as handball?
DERMOT SAYS:
"The ball can hit his arm accidentally."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
"Whether it's accidentaly or not, if it doesn't hit his arm, Mohammed Kudus goes through and scores. It's still stopping a goal-scoring opportunity."
INCIDENT:
If it's not handball, should he have been punished for the high challenge on Kudus?
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
"I thought he was going off. His knee is really high, Kudus could have got really hurt. And the fact it's hit his arm, Kudus is going to have a tap-in for the goal."
DERMOT SAYS:
"You can justify the ball hitting his arm but his challenge is probably the worst of the two."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
"How can you justify the ball hitting his arm?!"
DERMOT SAYS:
"He has to handle the ball deliberately. The second part is the grey area, because if the referee gives a foul, he's off."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
"It's lucky Tottenham won this game because if that was the deciding decision, there'd be big uproar.
Who cares if it's accidental or not, the handball. It's stopped a goal-scoring opportunity!

live_updates.title: Man City denied penalty vs Spurs
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
INCIDENT:
Micky van de Ven catches Oscar Bobb in the area but no penalty is awarded. City go on to lose the game 2-0.
DERMOT SAYS:
One of the clues is the player stretching. He stands on his foot. The referee gives no foul. What didn't help her case was at Arsenal there was a lesser contact and a foul was given.
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
Van de Ven has lunged - and when you lunge and make contact, it's definitely a penalty.

live_updates.title: Essential Football: Champions League final fall-out - where next for PSG and Inter?
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text: Ron Walker is in Munich’s Marienplatz with Sky Sports journalists Adam Bate and Declan Olley the morning after the Champions League final, to look back at PSG’s dominant victory over Inter Milan. We discuss if this is a start of PSG dominance and ask what next for Inter and manager Simone Inzaghi.

Caroline Barker and Juliette Ferrington takeover a very special England media day ahead of Euro 2025... getting all the gossip from the squad members themselves and finding out how they're preparing to try and retain the trophy this summer...

live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
What a tournament! England are now back-to-back European champions as they beat Spain 3-1 on penalties!
Nikita can't join us this week so Jordan gives us her reaction straight after another huge history-making night for the Lionesses.
Jordan gives us all the analysis on the nail-biting 90 minutes then into extra time which had everyone on the edge of their seats. Then... the penalties... and we don't think Jordan has quite recovered yet!
She also looks at just how inspirational this England team is and the importance of young talent.

live_updates.text:
In
Gary Neville's
first podcast of the new 2025/26 season, he reacts to
Arsenal's

Man Utd
at Old Trafford.
Neville is adamant that Manchester United need to sign a new goalkeeper in the summer transfer window.
He also lauds the performance of a new Man City signing after their resounding win against Wolves.
Neville backs one team to beat the drop by stating they demonstrated the qualities to achieve Premier League survival in their first match of the season.
Neville also believes there are three teams that all have genuine cases to be Premier League title contenders this season.

Sunderland had other ideas, as their 3-0 win over West Ham knocked out over 98% of the field, with just 1,337 players correctly predicting that scoreline (well done you)!

Round 2 saw another ONE MILLION Super 6 hopefuls with the £1,000,000 jackpot up for grabs again!
Although 34 per cent of players nailed Crystal Palace’s 1-1 draw with Forest on Sunday, by the end of Saturday’s action - including Brentford’s shock win over Aston Villa – just two players were still in the hunt for the million.

Proof, if it were needed, that Round 3 was as tough as they come!

live_updates.title: Ramazani set for Valencia loan
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell:
Leeds United
winger
Largie Ramazani
is expected to join
Valencia
on loan.
Ramazani was left out of Daniel Farke's squad for Saturday's 5-0 defeat at Arsenal amid talks with the Spanish club.
The 24-year-old, who has three years left on his Leeds contract, was also an unused substitute for Leeds' Premier League opener against Everton.
Ramazani has struggled for game-time at Leeds since joining last August from Spanish side Almeria.  He has not started a league match for the club since suffering an injury in October 2024.
Leeds are still in the market for attacking players - having already added Noah Okafor from AC Milan in an £18m deal earlier this week - which could further limit his minutes.
Ramazani will be working under former West Brom and Huddersfield boss Carlos Corberan if the deal goes through without a hitch.

live_updates.title: Leeds sign defender Justin from Leicester in £10m deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Leeds
have signed defender
James Justin
from
Leicester
in a £10m deal.
The Whites will pay an initial £8m fee plus £2m in add-ons for the 27-year-old, who has signed a four-year deal at Elland Road.
Justin becomes Leeds' 10th signing this summer and takes the club's spending beyond the £100m mark.
“Obviously to join a club of this size and to have the history it has had, and being back in the Premier League was a massive thing for me, so I’m over the moon to have joined,” James told the club’s official website.
“Everyone that I’ve spoken to about the club and the area has had great things to say about it. So I’m excited to join the lads and get to work.
“The stadium has obviously got one of the best atmospheres in world football.
“And it’s always a daunting task to come here as an opposing team, but I’m happy to have the fans behind me this time.”
Sky Sports News
understands Leicester are satisfied with the deal because Justin had only one year left on his Foxes contract.
The Championship side would have demanded a much higher price if he had longer on his contract.

live_updates.title: 'Three chances!' - Farke assesses DCL debut
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Leeds United
boss
Daniel Farke
is happy
Dominic Calvert-Lewin
is in a position to miss chances for his new side despite lacking match fitness.
Calvert-Lewin missed three chances from close range on his debut for the Whites and cannoned his penalty in the shoot-out over the bar, as Leeds bowed out of the Carabao Cup against Sheffield Wednesday.
“Three chances he had during the game, normally he scores two. I am happy he has the chances," Farke said to
Sky Sports
.
“For him, it’s like a pre-season. He needed the minutes to build up his fitness. We are not happy with the outcome but there were more things to think about, some players needed a rest after a busy start.
“Now, we concentrate on the Premier League. Sometimes if you don’t score the goals, you have to accept that the other team wins the game.”

live_updates.title: Leeds full-back set for Bundesliga move
live_updates.author: joeshread
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell:
Leeds
full-back
Isaac Schmidt
is set to join
Werder Bremen
on a season-long loan.
A deal has been agreed between the clubs that includes an option to buy for around £3.5m.
Schmidt is expected to arrive in Germany on Friday to finalise the move and undergo a medical.
Leeds were waiting to sign a replacement before letting Schmidt go - and have now brought in James Justin.

live_updates.title: Leeds agree mutual departure for Bamford
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Leeds United
and
Patrick Bamford
have reached a mutual agreement for the striker to leave the club this summer.
Earlier this summer, Whites boss
Daniel Farke told Bamford he is "not part" of his plans this season.
Bamford would have been training with the under-21 squad if he remained at the club.

live_updates.title: Leeds advancing in Buonanotte pursuit
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Leeds United
have advanced in their pursuit of
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Facundo Buonanotte.
Brighton have been keen for the 20-year-old to go on loan to an English club to gain more experience after his spell at Leicester last season.
Bounanotte fits the profile of player Leeds have been looking for as they try to bolster their creative options in the final third.
The Argentina international, who has been attracting interest from Champions League clubs, can play as a No 10 and on the right wing.
Buonanotte's departure from Brighton would be a straight loan with no obligation involved in the deal.
Sky Germany
reported earlier in the window that Dortmund had made a loan offer for the player.

live_updates.title: Okafor doubtful for Newcastle game
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Leeds
forward
Noah Okafor
is a doubt for Saturday’s visit of
Newcastle.
Okafor, who arrived at Elland Road in the summer in an £18m move from AC Milan, felt a pain in his groin after Tuesday’s Carabao Cup defeat to Sheffield Wednesday.
Boss Daniel Farke said: “He’s more or less the only player who came out of Sheffield Wednesday with a few doubts.
“We spoke about groin problems. He’s more or less the only major doubt.”
Okafor has impressed his new manager since arriving but Farke says there is more to come.
“There were glimpses of his class against Arsenal,” said Farke. “He was in good situations, had a great chance and should have scored with one chance.
“He showed he is capable of beating defenders with pace, creativity, strength, and dribbling. Solid start but space for improvement.”

live_updates.title: Farke: If we can keep up this points tally, I'll organise my own bus tour next summer
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Leeds manager
Daniel Farke
joked that he will organise his own bus tour in celebration if his team keep up their current points tally.
On their Premier League return, Leeds have earned four points from three games after drawing 0-0 with Newcastle on
Saturday Night Football.
He to
Sky Sports
: "I'm a happy man. Four points out of three really competitive games, two games here at home, two clean sheets. This is how you need to approach a new season, a newly promoted side, to be difficult to beat.
"We have played here today against one of the best sides in the Premier League, a side who has dominated on Monday [against Liverpool] with 11, but also with 10 men. We were pretty competitive and it was a tight game.
"We made it difficult for Newcastle to have chances. This is always the base, and the next steps will follow, but I didn't expect that we would come right now.
"If we can keep this points average then I will organise my own bus tour next summer.
"We want to be the first side who breaks this curse of getting relegated as a newly promoted side more or less early in February and March, and we're on a good path right now.
"But it's a long road and we have to win many more points… we keep our foot on the gas and we have to keep going."

live_updates.title: Gyabi leaves Leeds for Hull
live_updates.author: Jamie Hunt
live_updates.text:
Darko Gyabi is set to join Hull on permanent deal from Leeds United on Deadline Day.
The 21-year-old central midfielder spent last season on loan at Plymouth.
Leeds had been keen to sign Facundo Buonanotte from Brighton, but with the attacking midfielder closing in on a move to Chelsea, Leeds will need to move on to other targets.

live_updates.title: Farke: If we can keep up this points tally, I'll organise my own bus tour next summer
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Leeds manager
Daniel Farke
joked that he will organise his own bus tour in celebration if his team keep up their current points tally.
On their Premier League return, Leeds have earned four points from three games after drawing 0-0 with Newcastle on
Saturday Night Football.
He to
Sky Sports
: "I'm a happy man. Four points out of three really competitive games, two games here at home, two clean sheets. This is how you need to approach a new season, a newly promoted side, to be difficult to beat.
"We have played here today against one of the best sides in the Premier League, a side who has dominated on Monday [against Liverpool] with 11, but also with 10 men. We were pretty competitive and it was a tight game.
"We made it difficult for Newcastle to have chances. This is always the base, and the next steps will follow, but I didn't expect that we would come right now.
"If we can keep this points average then I will organise my own bus tour next summer.
"We want to be the first side who breaks this curse of getting relegated as a newly promoted side more or less early in February and March, and we're on a good path right now.
"But it's a long road and we have to win many more points… we keep our foot on the gas and we have to keep going."

live_updates.title: Gyabi leaves Leeds for Hull
live_updates.author: Jamie Hunt
live_updates.text:
Darko Gyabi is set to join Hull on permanent deal from Leeds United on Deadline Day.
The 21-year-old central midfielder spent last season on loan at Plymouth.
Leeds had been keen to sign Facundo Buonanotte from Brighton, but with the attacking midfielder closing in on a move to Chelsea, Leeds will need to move on to other targets.
Daniel Farke is keen to add an attacking option, or options, who can play in wide areas as well as the no.10 role.

live_updates.title: Gyabi leaves Leeds for Hull
live_updates.author: Jamie Hunt
live_updates.text:
Darko Gyabi is set to join Hull on a permanent deal from Leeds United on Deadline Day.
The 21-year-old central midfielder spent last season on loan at Plymouth.
Leeds had been keen to sign Facundo Buonanotte from Brighton, but with the attacking midfielder closing in on a move to Chelsea, Leeds will need to move on to other targets.
Daniel Farke is keen to add an attacking option, or options, who can play in wide areas as well as the No 10 role.

live_updates.title: Leeds in talks for Wilson
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmsh Sheth, Rob Dorsett and ZinnyBoswell:
Leeds are in talks with Fulham over the signing of Harry Wilson.
Daniel Farke's side are trying to bring in a forward before the deadline.
They were in for Brighton's Facundo Buonanotte on loan before Chelsea came in.
The teenager has now joined Chelsea on a straight loan for the season.
Leeds have just over three hours left before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Leeds in talks for Wilson
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth, Rob Dorsett and Zinny Boswell:
Leeds are in talks with Fulham over the signing of Harry Wilson.
Daniel Farke's side are trying to bring in a forward before the deadline.
They were in for Brighton's Facundo Buonanotte on loan before Chelsea came in.
The teenager has now joined Chelsea on a straight loan for the season.
Leeds have just over three hours left before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Why Wilson's move to Leeds fell through
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell:
Fulham
pulled the plug on
Harry Wilson's
Deadline Day move to
Leeds
at the very last minute,
Sky Sports News
understands.
Leeds and Wilson had signed a deal sheet in the hope of finalising a move.
However, it is understood Fulham did not to sign the paperwork required for the Premier League to grant an additional two hours to get the transfer over the line.
Fulham insist they were clear that Wilson was not for sale, while Leeds feel they were encouraged to increase their offer for the Wales international on Deadline Day.
Leeds were first made aware of Wilson's potential availability over the weekend as Fulham pursued the signings of Kevin and Samuel Chukwueze.
Wilson was keen on the move as his opportunities were already limited at Fulham and both players will be directly competing with him for minutes, only decreasing his chances of playing.
Although there is frustration over missing out on Wilson, Leeds are understood to be very happy with their business this summer.
The priority for the window was strengthening the spine of Daniel Farke's team for the Premier League return - and they managed to do that with plenty of time to spare by bringing in the likes of Anton Stach, Jaka Bijol and Lucas Perri.
Leeds have backed Farke to the tune of more than £100m this summer with 10 new additions.

live_updates.title: Why Wilson's move to Leeds fell through
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell:
Fulham
pulled the plug on
Harry Wilson's
Deadline Day move to
Leeds
at the very last minute,
Sky Sports News
understands.
Leeds and Wilson had signed a deal sheet in the hope of finalising a move.
However, it is understood Fulham did not to sign the paperwork required for the Premier League to grant an additional two hours to get the transfer over the line.
Fulham insist they were clear that Wilson was not for sale, while Leeds feel they were encouraged to increase their offer for the Wales international on Deadline Day.
Leeds were first made aware of Wilson's potential availability over the weekend as Fulham pursued the signings of Kevin and Samuel Chukwueze.
Wilson was keen on the move as his opportunities were already limited at Fulham and both players will be directly competing with him for minutes, only decreasing his chances of playing.
Although there is frustration over missing out on Wilson, Leeds are understood to be very happy with their business this summer.
The priority for the window was strengthening the spine of Daniel Farke's team for the Premier League return - and they managed to do that with plenty of time to spare by bringing in the likes of Anton Stach, Jaka Bijol and Lucas Perri.
Leeds have backed Farke to the tune of more than £100m this summer with 10 new additions.

live_updates.title: Arteta eyeing 'convincing' win at Anfield
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta on facing Liverpool:
"Very important game. You want to continue building the momentum we are in right now. Going to those grounds, against this kind of opposition, is what you want. Coming from those big games winning in a really convincing way, that's the objective."
On what's needed to end winless run at Anfield since 2012:
"Be better, be more efficient, and do what we have done with many other stats we had, even for longer. Just go there and be convinced we can go to Anfield and win."

live_updates.title: Arteta on Arsenal's injury problems
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta on addressing Arsenal's injury issues:
"We have to analyse what we do, that's for sure. In the previous season, we had the best [injury] record in the Premier League. The following season, we had one of the worst, as well because of the extent of the injuries of certain players - Tomiyasu, Gabriel Jesus, the long-term injuries we had with the hamstring injuries.
"We have looked at everything. We are continually monitoring and evolving the needs of the players and the schedule. Unfortunately we picked up very diverse injuries again, some of them very unexpected."

live_updates.title: Arteta: Martinelli still super-important
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta on whether Gabriel Martinelli could leave:
"No. I think Gabby has been a super-important player for us and he is going to remain very important.
"The fact we have options, with different qualities, that's going to fulfil what we want, because every opponent requires different things.
"We have that competition in many other areas of the pitch and it's needed in the front line, to start the game, and to finish the game.
"I'm very happy with what we have."

live_updates.title: Arteta: Arsenal aiming to take Liverpool's crown
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta:
"The favourite is always the one that won in the previous year. Someone has to come and take that crown away from them, and that's what we, the rest, are going to try to do.
"We have already started with the first two games in the Premier League, and that's the aim, be better than them."

live_updates.title: Arteta: Saka hamstring injuries a big concern
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta asked whether he is concerned by Bukayo Saka's hamstring injuries:
"Yes it is a big [concern], especially when we talk about a sprinter, a player who gets into that zone very often, who needs that burst, that change of pace to be as threatening as possible.
"We will learn again why it happened and make him stronger, but unfortunately injuries are part of your career. He hasn't had that many, with the amount of games he has played, but it's something we want to eradicate."

live_updates.title: How does the injury table look?
live_updates.author: Adam Smith
live_updates.text:
Crystal Palace
,
Spurs
and
Sunderland
all have seven players sidelined with injuries or suspensions heading into matchday three.
You can use the interactive table below to see the full list of players...

live_updates.title: Emery: We are very busy
live_updates.author: Adam Bate
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Adam Bate at Aston Villa's training ground:
Unai Emery
acknowledged that
Aston Villa
’s start to the season has been “poor” and does not expect it to get easier against a Crystal Palace side that has proven a tricky match-up for his side under Oliver Glasner.
The Villa boss is hoping to get some help in the next few days before the transfer window closes, however. “We are very busy. We are working here, we are active,” he said.
Asked by
Sky Sports
about the possibility of
Marco Asensio
returning, he added: “I don't want to speak about some players because we have different options. Of course, you are asking me about Marco Asensio, I was so happy with him [last season] in general.”

live_updates.title: Hurzeler '100 per cent sure' Baleba stays at Brighton
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Fabian Hurzeler
has said he is 100 per cent confident
Carlos Baleba
will remain a
Brighton
player beyond the transfer window shutting on September 1.
The midfielder has been the subject of interest from Man Utd this summer, but the Seagulls have remained firm in their stance that Baleba is not for sale.
"If there was a number higher than 100 I would give you that," Hurzeler said in his pre-Man City press conference on Thursday.
He also added that his gut instinct is there won't be any more incomings at Brighton, and reiterated his happiness with the shape of the squad.

live_updates.title: Enciso back at Brighton after injury derails move
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Fabian Hurzeler
says
Julio Enciso
has returned to
Brighton
to continue his rehabilitation amid reports his move to Strasbourg could be off.
Enciso was expected to join the French club for around £20m, with a deal close to being finalised this time last week.
However, the attacking midfielder, who does not feature in Hurzeler's plans, is now back at Brighton with less than five days of the window to go.
Asked to clear up Enciso's situation, Hurzeler said: "It is not a big injury, so he is back in rehab training.
"It is very important that the players now are our plans for the future.
"We have an open conversation with Julio and then we will see what happens in the next days."

live_updates.title: Brighton open to offers for Sarmiento
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Cremonese
are also in talks over the signing of
Brighton
winger
Jeremy Sarmiento
, according to
Sky in Italy
.
Brighton are open to letting him go before the window closes.
Sarmiento has spent the last three seasons on loan at different clubs in the Championship.
The 23-year-old played for Burnley in the previous campaign as they gained automatic promotion to the Premier League.
He has two years left on his current deal at Brighton.

live_updates.title: Leeds advancing in Buonanotte pursuit
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Leeds United
have advanced in their pursuit of
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Facundo Buonanotte.
Brighton have been keen for the 20-year-old to go on loan to an English club to gain more experience after his spell at Leicester last season.
Bounanotte fits the profile of player Leeds have been looking for as they try to bolster their creative options in the final third.
The Argentina international, who has been attracting interest from Champions League clubs, can play as a No 10 and on the right wing.
Buonanotte's departure from Brighton would be a straight loan with no obligation involved in the deal.
Sky Germany
reported earlier in the window that Dortmund had made a loan offer for the player.

live_updates.title: Abdallah Sima joins Lens
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Brighton
striker
Abdallah Sima
has joined Ligue 1 club
Lens
in a deal worth £4m plus add-ons.
The forward, who never made a Premier League appearance for the Premier League side after joining in 2021, has had loan spells at Stoke, Angers, Rangers and Stade Brestois.
Brighton are working on trimming their squad ahead of Monday's deadline.
Facundo Buonanotte
could depart to Chelsea with talks ongoing between the west London club and Brighton.
Jeremy Sarmiento
may also leave while Tariq Lamptey is attracting interest.

live_updates.title: Brighton's Enciso edging closer to Strasbourg move
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Chelsea's
owners BlueCo are edging closer to completing a deal with
Brighton
for
Julio Enciso
to join
Strasbourg
.
The 21-year-old is being offered a five-year contract.
It is expected the transfer will be completed before the window closes on Monday.
Sky Sports News
reported on Thursday that Enciso had returned to Brighton to continue his rehab on a knee injury.
The Paraguay international will initially move to BlueCo-owned Strasbourg.
Enciso is not part of Fabian Hurzeler's plans this season and spent the second half of last season on loan at Ipswich.

live_updates.title: Chelsea close to completing loan signing of Brighton's Buonanotte
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook and Mark McAdam:
Chelsea
are close to completing the loan signing of
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Facundo Buonanotte
.
The deal under discussion does not include an option or an obligation to buy - it is a season-long loan.
There was interest in the 20-year-old from other Premier League clubs, including
Leeds United
.
Brighton only wanted to loan the Argentina international to a club in England.
Borussia Dortmund
had made a loan offer for the player with an option, while there was also interest from French outfit
Lyon
.

live_updates.title: Cremonese reach agreement for Sarmiento
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Cremonese
have reached an agreement with
Brighton
for the signing of winger
Jeremy Sarmiento
, according to
Sky in Italy.
The deal is for a loan with an option to buy, which could become an obligation if the Italian club avoid relegation from Serie A.
Sarmiento has two years left on his current deal at Brighton.

live_updates.title: Fiorentina agree Lamptey deal
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News'  Mark McAdam and Elliot Cook:
Fiorentina
have agreed a deal with
Brighton
for the signing of
Tariq Lamptey.
The transfer is worth up to £6m including add-ons.
Lamptey still needs to take a medical and finalise terms with the Italian club before the move goes through.

live_updates.title: Hurzeler: Football is not always about tactics
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Brighton
boss
Fabian Hurzeler
claimed "football is not always about tactics" after his side came back to beat Manchester City.
Hurzeler made a quadruple substitution in the 61st minute which saw James Milner cancel out Erling Haaland's opener before Brajan Gruda netted a late winner.
"Football is not always about tactics, it is sometimes about energy and the energy you put on the pitch. We showed it today. In the second half, we had this energy," he said.
"This can win you games. We didn't believe in ourselves [before the substitutes]. I decided to make the four changes. It is always a decision we make together."

live_updates.title: Brighton super subs inflict another defeat on Man City
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text: Manchester City suffered their second defeat from their opening three Premier League games after collapsing to a late 2-1 loss at Brighton.

live_updates.title: Brighton's O'Riley set for Marseille medical
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brighton
’s
Matt O’Riley
is understood to be travelling to France this morning for a medical with
Marseille
.
The midfielder is set to join them on a straight loan with no option to make the deal permanent.
O'Riley was left on the bench yesterday as Brighton beat Manchester City.
Marseille are managed by former Brighton head coach
Roberto de Zerbi
.

live_updates.title: Palace close to signing Brighton's Igor
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Crystal Palace
are close to an agreement with
Brighton
over a loan deal for defender
Igor Julio
.
Sky Sports News
has been told the deal includes an option for Palace to buy him at the end of the season.
Plans are in place for Igor to travel to South London for a medical later today.
West Ham
held an interest in the player, but Palace now looks his more likely destination.

live_updates.title: Lamptey joins Fiorentina on permanent deal
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam and Elliot Cook:
Brighton
have announced right-back
Tariq Lamptey
has joined
Fiorentina
on a permanent deal.
The 24-year-old is moving to Serie A in a deal worth up to £6m including add-ons.
Sky Sports News
reported on Saturday that an agreement had been reached between the two clubs.
Lamptey signed a one-year contract extension at Brighton in June but selling the player now means the Premier League club will receive a fee, instead of losing him for nothing.

live_updates.title: Brighton's O'Riley set for Marseille medical
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Matt O'Riley
has arrived in
Marseille
ahead of his loan move from
Brighton
.
The Denmark international has been pictured with fans outside Marseille's training ground.
The midfielder is set to join them on a straight loan with no option to make the deal permanent.
O'Riley was left on the bench yesterday as Brighton beat Manchester City.
Marseille are managed by former Brighton head coach
Roberto de Zerbi
.

live_updates.title: More Brighton exits expected
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporter Chris Nightingale:
Brighton
have let a lot of players go this summer and that number is only going to increase throughout Deadline Day with updates on
Julio Enciso, Facundo Buonanotte, Jeremy Sarmiento
and
Matt O’Riley
still to come.
Manager Fabian Hurzeler has spoken about the need to trim his squad throughout this window, but it’s easy to see some areas could become light with injury.

live_updates.title: Enciso joins Strasbourg
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Julio Enciso
has completed his move to French club
Strasbourg
.
The 21-year-old has joined on a permanent deal for a fee understood to be £10m.
Brighton have a sell-on clause as part of the deal.
Enciso is the second player who has left the club today after
Tariq Lamptey
joined Fiorentina.

live_updates.title: Buonanotte moves to Chelsea on loan
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Facundo Buonanotte
has joined
Chelsea
on a season-long loan.
There is no option or obligation to buy.
There was strong interest from other Premier League clubs including Leeds.
The Argentina international, who prefers to play in the No 10 position, has become the latest Brighton player to move to Chelsea.
Sky Sports News
reported on Friday that Chelsea were close to completing the deal.
Brighton head coach
Fabian Hurzeler
said: “This is a great opportunity for Facundo to play regular Premier League and Champions League football this season and further his development.
“Facundo has great potential and we see his long-term future with us here, and we will be monitoring his progress."

live_updates.title: Brighton make Gomez enquiry
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett and Vinny O'Connor:
Brighton & Hove Albion made an enquiry to take Joe Gomez on loan for the season, but were unable to reach an agreement with Liverpool over how his wages would be split between the two clubs.
Liverpool were unwilling to sanction a loan move, having already rejected a number of enquiries for the defender. AC Milan also explored a deal earlier in the window, but there was not enough time to complete the transfer once Marc Guehi’s move to Anfield became the focus.
As a result, Gomez will be staying at Liverpool this summer, even if Guehi completes his switch.

live_updates.title: Julio not joining Palace - as things stand
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Igor Julio
is not going to join
Crystal Palace
as things stand, despite completing a medical there this afternoon -
West Ham
are now in talks with
Brighton
and the player to try to complete a deal to take him on loan.
Palace were adamant that they would only allow Marc Guehi to leave for Liverpool once they had a replacement in. That replacement was Igor.
Sky Sports News
has been told Palace have
NOT
called Guehi back from his medical with Liverpool in London - instead, they are now looking at alternative options to fill their centre back void.

live_updates.title: Julio not joining Palace - as things stand
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett, Chris Reidy and James Savundra:
Igor Julio
is on his way from
Crystal Palace
to
West Ham
after deciding against a move to Selhurst Park.
The Brighton defender is not joining Palace despite completing a medical there this afternoon.
West Ham
are now in talks with
Brighton
and the player to try to complete a deal to take him on loan.
Palace were adamant they would only allow
Marc Guehi
to leave for Liverpool once they had a replacement in. That replacement was Igor.
Sky Sports News
has been told Palace have
NOT
called Guehi back from his medical with Liverpool in London.
It is understood Igor had concerns about his potential playing time at Palace as they are also looking to sign other central defenders.

live_updates.title: West Ham announce Julio loan signing
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
West Ham
have announced the signing defender
Igor Julio
on a season-long loan from Brighton.
The 27-year-old had been set to join Crystal Palace, even undertaking a medical, but decided to join the Hammers instead.
It is understood that Julio had concerns about his potential playing time at Crystal Palace. It ultimately curtailed
Marc Guehi's proposed move to Liverpool.
“I am really happy to be here at West Ham United,” Julio told the
club's media.
“It is a big club, an historic club, with fantastic support and a special identity.
“I saw this in Prague during the Conference League final two years ago, and I feel very proud to now be representing the colours.
“The project here is very exciting – there are many good players at the club and I know that there is a very positive environment in the dressing room that it will be great to be a part of.
“I am ready for the challenge and looking forward to giving everything I can to help the team and the club.”

live_updates.title: Buonanotte moves to Chelsea on loan
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Facundo Buonanotte
has joined
Chelsea
on a season-long loan.
There is no option or obligation to buy.
There was strong interest from other Premier League clubs including Leeds.
The Argentina international, who prefers to play in the No 10 position, has become the latest Brighton player to move to Chelsea.
Sky Sports News
reported on Friday that Chelsea were close to completing the deal.
Brighton head coach
Fabian Hurzeler
said: “This is a great opportunity for Facundo to play regular Premier League and Champions League football this season and further his development.
“Facundo has great potential and we see his long-term future with us here, and we will be monitoring his progress."

live_updates.title: Marseille sign O'Riley on loan - but he still has Brighton future
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Marseille
have completed the season-long loan signing of
Brighton
midfielder
Matt O'Riley
.
The deal for the Denmark international is a straight loan with no option.
Seagulls head coach
Fabian Hurzeler
said: "Matt has the opportunity to challenge himself at the highest level in France and in the Champions League.
"We have a lot of competition in the midfield positions, and while we see Matt's long-term future here with us, this gives him the potential of more game time.
"We will monitor his progress throughout the season with Marseille, and we wish him well for the rest of the season."

live_updates.title: Barnsley tie on Sky Sports+ on September 23
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Brighton's
Carabao Cup third round tie away to
Barnsley
will take place on September 23, live on
Sky Sports+
and kicking off at 7.45pm.
Their Premier League games either side of the tie, at home to
Tottenham
on Saturday September 20 and away to
Chelsea
on September 27, are not impacted.

Palmeiras
are close to agreeing a deal with
Fulham
over the signing of midfielder
Andreas Pereira
.
The deal is worth in the region of €10m (£8.6m)
Pereira had entered the final year of his Fulham contract - though the club did have the option to extend for a further year.

live_updates.title: Fulham making progress on Shakhtar's Kevin
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Fulham
are making progress towards an agreement for
Shakhtar’s Kevin.
There is still plenty of work to do to strike a deal - but Fulham are pushing hard in talks for the left-winger.
The club want to sign a right-winger as well and have interest in
Samuel Chukwueze
,
Raheem Sterling
and
Reiss Nelson
among others.
Fulham prefer to do permanent deals for younger players with potential but loans have not been ruled out.
Fulham also want to sign a new midfielder, with
Andreas Periera
increasingly likely to join Palmeiras.

live_updates.title: Silva frustrated as wait for signings goes on
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News' James Cole at the Fulham training ground:
"Marco Silva cut a frustrated figure at his press conference ahead of Saturday’s trip to Stamford Bridge.
"Fulham have still made just one signing in this transfer window: back-up keeper
Benjamin Lecomte
from Montpellier.
"That’s despite Silva’s repeated calls for reinforcements - specifically two wingers and a midfielder.
"Fulham are in talks to sign Shakhtar left winger
Kevin
, and are interested in AC Milan right winger,
Samuel Chukwueze
.
"However neither deal has yet materialised - and time is running out.
"Silva’s comments today sent a clear message to the club’s hierarchy: failure to deliver those three signings will make it impossible for the club to compete at the level they did last season.  The question is - are they listening?
"This feels like a crossroads moment for Silva and Fulham. He has just one season left on his contract, something which is making some fans very nervous about his long-term future at Craven Cottage."

from

The 29-year-old has signed a three-year contract with the Brazilian side.

live_updates.title: Silva slams 'unbelievable' decision to rule out King goal
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Marco Silva
has slammed the "unbelievable" decision to disallow
Josh King's
goal against
Chelsea
.
King thought he had opened the scoring in the 21st minute after racing into the box and tucking his effort past Robert Sanchez, only to see his celebrations cut short following a VAR review.
Rodrigo Muniz was deemed to have impeded Trevoh Chalobah with a "careless challenge" in the build-up to the goal, with the decision confirmed by referee Rob Jones to Stamford Bridge shortly after.
"Unbelievable decision, unbelievable. I am not in the best mood to [talk about it] but it was unbelievable how the goal was disallowed," Silva said in his post-match press conference.
"Harsh for him [King], a boy who was dreaming for this moment all of his career.
"Great moment for him and should not be disallowed.
"I would love to explain many things. The first goal - eight minutes extra time. After the first corner it was already nine minutes. It is time to stop the game. That is the rules.
"I asked the referee and he said because we lost time. But I checked the eight minutes. The game didn't stop.
"It's very difficult. I make mistakes, the referee makes mistakes, but when it is black or white, we cannot see something that is not there.
When asked if he had spoken to the match officials after the game, Silva added: "No, I did not speak with him. I spoke with him at half-time to try to understand why the goal was disallowed."
Silva also confirmed that he would not push for an official complaint to be sent to the PGMOL but did say they expect explanations.

agree club-record £34.6m (€40m) deal to sign
Kevin
from
Shakhtar Donetsk
.

The deal will surpass the initial £27m paid by Fulham for Emile Smith-Rowe from Arsenal last summer.
The 22-year-old Brazilian could become just Fulham's second summer signing, with goalkeeper Benjamin Lecomte from Montpellier their only arrival so far.

a season-long loan plus an option to buy permanently for between £21.6m and £26m.

live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:

Leeds United
are in talks with
Fulham
over the signing of

.
Daniel Farke

They were in for
Brighton

The teenager has now joined

Martial Godo

from

The 22-year-old winger had been the subject of strong interest from Coventry this summer.

Fulham
are now close to completing a deal for
Kevin
.
The Sporting threat is believed to have gone away.
Final details on the deal are being sorted between all sides.
Kevin has already done a medical, and Samuel Chukwueze and Tyrique George are set to follow.

live_updates.title: Wilson staying at Fulham
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Cole:
Harry Wilson
is staying at
Fulham.
Leeds United were talks over the signing as they looked to bring in the forward, but the move did not go through.
Wilson is with the Wales squad in Cardiff and preparing for their World Cup qualifier against Kazakhstan on Thursday.

live_updates.title: Fulham complete Chukwueze loan signing
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Fulham
have signed
Samuel Chukwueze
from
AC Milan
on loan for the season, with an option to make the move permanent.
A Nigeria international alongside Alex Iwobi and Calvin Bassey, Chukwueze will wear the number 19 shirt.
Speaking to the
club's media
, the 26-year-old said: “I’m so happy to be here. It’s an amazing club. It feels like home, because I have my people around me.
“I feel at home already, and I can’t wait to get started.”

live_updates.title: George to Fulham not done in time
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Cole:
Fulham's
attempted deal to sign
Chelsea
forward
Tyrique George
did not go through.
It was set to be a permanent deal worth £22m after a five-year contract had been agreed.

live_updates.title: Why Wilson's move to Leeds fell through
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell:
Fulham
pulled the plug on
Harry Wilson's
Deadline Day move to
Leeds
at the very last minute,
Sky Sports News
understands.
Leeds and Wilson had signed a deal sheet in the hope of finalising a move.
However, it is understood Fulham did not to sign the paperwork required for the Premier League to grant an additional two hours to get the transfer over the line.
Fulham insist they were clear that Wilson was not for sale, while Leeds feel they were encouraged to increase their offer for the Wales international on Deadline Day.
Leeds were first made aware of Wilson's potential availability over the weekend as Fulham pursued the signings of Kevin and Samuel Chukwueze.
Wilson was keen on the move as his opportunities were already limited at Fulham and both players will be directly competing with him for minutes, only decreasing his chances of playing.
Although there is frustration over missing out on Wilson, Leeds are understood to be very happy with their business this summer.
The priority for the window was strengthening the spine of Daniel Farke's team for the Premier League return - and they managed to do that with plenty of time to spare by bringing in the likes of Anton Stach, Jaka Bijol and Lucas Perri.
Leeds have backed Farke to the tune of more than £100m this summer with 10 new additions.

live_updates.title: Fulham sign Kevin for club-record deal
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Fulham
have confirmed the signing of
Kevin
for a club-record deal of £34.6m (€40m).
The winger joins from
Shakhtar Donetsk
and has agreed a five-year deal.
Sporting showed late interest in Kevin, but the Premier League club fended off the Portuguese side.
He told the club's media: “I am happy to be in the biggest league in the world, at a huge club, too. I’m very flattered for everything that’s happening in my life, and I hope to score a lot of goals this season and do great work here in Fulham.”

live_updates.title: Fulham's Kusi-Asare deal went through in time

live_updates.text:

Fulham's
deal to sign
Bayern Munich
striker
Johan Kusi-Asare
went through in time.
The west London club explored a loan but would only go ahead if there was an option to make it a permanent deal at the end of the loan period.
A formal announcement is expected at some point today.

live_updates.title: Fulham confirm Kusi-Asare signing
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Fulham
have confirmed the signing of
Bayern Munich
striker
Johan Kusi-Asare
on loan with an option to make the move permanent.
Sky Sports News
understands the west London club explored a loan but would only go ahead if there was an option to make it a permanent deal at the end of the loan period.
Speaking in a statement released by the club, Kusi-Asare said: “I’m really excited to join Fulham. It’s a fantastic club with great supporters, and I can’t wait to get started, work with my teammates and give everything for the club.”
